page.title: 06WEDMORE CUSTOMS AND EVENTS
page.content: {Wedmore Harvest Home}began in 1920 with only stalls and a luncheon for the farmers and workers! In the 1930's there were roundabouts and more sophisticated rides. It was not held during the 2nd World War.The harvest home begins with a procession of floats which are judged.Then the Portreeves lead them to the Harvest Home field for a men only luncheon in a marquee, while the children enjoy the fair. The{Wedmore Young Farmers' Show and {Sale}held every April since 1934 in the George inn-yard, presents cups for livestock and handicrafts (see photo). { The Street Fair,}held since Medieval times, still closes the Borough, the old market street, with colourful stalls, Morris dancing and exhibitions of local crafts.
